snippet: When strong, shifting winds are driving the flames, as in Alberta, fire can move unpredictably and quickly leap obstacles, making containment efforts ineffective and dangerous.
abstract: Experts say certain conditions make fighting fire such as one currently engulfing Fort McMurray, Alberta, futile; combination of high temperatures, excessive drought, and gusting winds requires shift away from battling blaze to rescue and evacuation.
lead_paragraph: When strong, shifting winds are driving the flames, as in Alberta, fire can move unpredictably and quickly leap obstacles, making containment efforts ineffective and dangerous.

headline.main: Forces of Nature Conspire Against Firefighters Around Fort McMurray
headline.print_headline: Forces of Nature Conspire Against the Firefighters
